diff_analysis.evidence: Old babel/localedata.py constructed locale data file paths directly with os.path.join(_dirname, '%s.dat' % name) in exists() and load() without sanitizing or normalizing the locale identifier. An attacker-controlled locale name containing path separators (e.g., '../') could traverse out of the intended locale-data directory and cause reading of arbitrary files. The patch introduces resolve_locale_filename() and wraps name with os.path.basename(), and adds Windows reserved-name checks, mitigating this path traversal risk.
